title-group.article-title: Development of a Fuel Efficient Multipurpose 75W-90 Gear Lubricant

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 2004 Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc.

abstract.p: Automotive gear oil development has expanded beyond the historical requirements of emphasizing wear protection to encompass modern needs for fuel economy and limited slip frictional properties. This paper describes the development process of a new generation, fuel efficient gear lubricant for use in light duty vehicles. A systematic formulation approach was used, encompassing fluid viscometrics and additive optimization. Performance testing in both laboratory and vehicle tests is described. Though standard GL-5 tests were used to confirm oxidation, wear and corrosion performance, emphasis is given to those methods used for optimizing fuel economy.

ref.mixed-citation: Ford Motor Company Material Specification WSS-M2C1 53-H, SAE 5W-20 Engine Oil.
